result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (6th) and Operating w/ PAC (6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (6th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] was dismissed by the court.

  • Michael B Peterson was found guilty of OWI (6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: IID restriction effective upon licensure for 36 mo.

Crt orders JOC be amended to include good time provision.  Amended Judgment of Conviction prepared.
Associated with Charge #1

Based on financial information provided to the Court by the defendant, the Court has found that the defendant's household income is no more than 150% of the federal nonfarm poverty guideline.
Therefore it is Ordered that an Ignition Interlock Device (IID) shall be installed and maintained for 50% of the normal costs.
Plea Questionnaire & Waiver of Rights.  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.  Judgment of conviction prepared.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per count. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release.
- Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle.
- Defendant shall not consume alcohol.
  - The court orders a signature bond in the amount of $500.00 per count on the condition that the defendant reports to, and complies with, Dane County Bail Monitoring (DCBM).  The defendant shall report to DCBM by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail.   If the defendant fails to comply with Dane County Bail Monitoring. Cash bail is automatically set in the amount of $3000.00, as higher cash bail is necessary to assure appearance in court. If Defendant posts this higher amount of bail and is released from jail, the Sheriff is directed to notify DCBM. If Defendant is out of custody, supervision by DCBM is required to enforce conditions of release and protect the public.The Defendant shall report to DCBM by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail. Defendant is ordered to cooperate with DCBM.
  Defendant waived the time limits for Preliminary Hearing.
